commit.message:
configure.in (ENUM_BITFIELDS_ARE_UNSIGNED): Delete redundant call to AC_MSG_RESULT.

       * configure.in (ENUM_BITFIELDS_ARE_UNSIGNED): Delete redundant
       call to AC_MSG_RESULT.

From-SVN: r33385

files.patch:
@@ -1,3 +1,8 @@
+2000-04-24  Kaveh R. Ghazi  <ghazi@caip.rutgers.edu>
+
+	* configure.in (ENUM_BITFIELDS_ARE_UNSIGNED): Delete redundant
+	call to AC_MSG_RESULT.
+
 2000-04-24  Martin v. L�wis  <loewis@informatik.hu-berlin.de>
 
 	* invoke.texi: Correct grammatical errors, document

@@ -2236,7 +2236,6 @@ fi
 
 fi
 
-echo "$ac_t""$gcc_cv_enum_bf_unsigned" 1>&6
 echo "$ac_t""$gcc_cv_enum_bf_unsigned" 1>&6
 if test $gcc_cv_enum_bf_unsigned = yes; then
   cat >> confdefs.h <<\EOF
@@ -2251,12 +2250,12 @@ for ac_func in strtoul bsearch putenv popen bcopy bzero bcmp \
 	fputs_unlocked getrusage valloc
 do
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2255: checking for $ac_func" >&5
+echo "configure:2254: checking for $ac_func" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2260 "configure"
+#line 2259 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char $ac_func(); below.  */
@@ -2279,7 +2278,7 @@ $ac_func();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:2283: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:2282: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -2308,12 +2307,12 @@ done
 #AC_CHECK_TYPE(wchar_t, unsigned int)
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for vprintf""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2312: checking for vprintf" >&5
+echo "configure:2311: checking for vprintf" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_vprintf'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2317 "configure"
+#line 2316 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char vprintf(); below.  */
@@ -2336,7 +2335,7 @@ vprintf();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:2340: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:2339: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_vprintf=yes"
 else
@@ -2360,12 +2359,12 @@ fi
 
 if test "$ac_cv_func_vprintf" != yes; then
 echo $ac_n "checking for _doprnt""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2364: checking for _doprnt" >&5
+echo "configure:2363: checking for _doprnt" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func__doprnt'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2369 "configure"
+#line 2368 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char _doprnt(); below.  */
@@ -2388,7 +2387,7 @@ _doprnt();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:2392: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:2391: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func__doprnt=yes"
 else
@@ -2424,15 +2423,15 @@ fi
 
 
 echo $ac_n "checking whether the printf functions support %p""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2428: checking whether the printf functions support %p" >&5
+echo "configure:2427: checking whether the printf functions support %p" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gcc_cv_func_printf_ptr'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   if test "$cross_compiling" = yes; then
   gcc_cv_func_printf_ptr=no
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2436 "configure"
+#line 2435 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <stdio.h>
 
@@ -2445,7 +2444,7 @@ main()
   exit (p != q);
 }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:2449: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
+if { (eval echo configure:2448: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
 then
   gcc_cv_func_printf_ptr=yes
 else
@@ -2478,12 +2477,12 @@ case "${host}" in
   ;;
 esac
 echo $ac_n "checking for pid_t""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2482: checking for pid_t" >&5
+echo "configure:2481: checking for pid_t" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_pid_t'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2487 "configure"
+#line 2486 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #if STDC_HEADERS
@@ -2512,17 +2511,17 @@ fi
 
 ac_safe=`echo "vfork.h" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 echo $ac_n "checking for vfork.h""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2516: checking for vfork.h" >&5
+echo "configure:2515: checking for vfork.h" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_$ac_safe'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2521 "configure"
+#line 2520 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <vfork.h>
 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:2526: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:2525: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out | grep -v "^conftest.${ac_ext}\$"`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*
@@ -2547,18 +2546,18 @@ else
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for working vfork""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2551: checking for working vfork" >&5
+echo "configure:2550: checking for working vfork" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_vfork_works'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   if test "$cross_compiling" = yes; then
   echo $ac_n "checking for vfork""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2557: checking for vfork" >&5
+echo "configure:2556: checking for vfork" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_vfork'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2562 "configure"
+#line 2561 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char vfork(); below.  */
@@ -2581,7 +2580,7 @@ vfork();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:2585: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:2584: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_vfork=yes"
 else
@@ -2603,7 +2602,7 @@ fi
 ac_cv_func_vfork_works=$ac_cv_func_vfork
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2607 "configure"
+#line 2606 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* Thanks to Paul Eggert for this test.  */
 #include <stdio.h>
@@ -2698,7 +2697,7 @@ main() {
   }
 }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:2702: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
+if { (eval echo configure:2701: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
 then
   ac_cv_func_vfork_works=yes
 else
@@ -2724,17 +2723,17 @@ for ac_hdr in unistd.h
 do
 ac_safe=`echo "$ac_hdr" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_hdr""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2728: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
+echo "configure:2727: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_$ac_safe'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2733 "configure"
+#line 2732 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <$ac_hdr>
 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:2738: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:2737: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out | grep -v "^conftest.${ac_ext}\$"`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*
@@ -2763,12 +2762,12 @@ done
 for ac_func in getpagesize
 do
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2767: checking for $ac_func" >&5
+echo "configure:2766: checking for $ac_func" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2772 "configure"
+#line 2771 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char $ac_func(); below.  */
@@ -2791,7 +2790,7 @@ $ac_func();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:2795: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:2794: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -2816,15 +2815,15 @@ fi
 done
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for working mmap from /dev/zero""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2820: checking for working mmap from /dev/zero" >&5
+echo "configure:2819: checking for working mmap from /dev/zero" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_mmap_anywhere'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   if test "$cross_compiling" = yes; then
   ac_cv_func_mmap_anywhere=no
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2828 "configure"
+#line 2827 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 /* Test by Richard Henderson and Alexandre Oliva.
@@ -2896,7 +2895,7 @@ int main()
   exit(0);
 }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:2900: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
+if { (eval echo configure:2899: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
 then
   ac_cv_func_mmap_anywhere=yes
 else
@@ -2919,7 +2918,7 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for working mmap of a file""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2923: checking for working mmap of a file" >&5
+echo "configure:2922: checking for working mmap of a file" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_mmap_file'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
@@ -2934,7 +2933,7 @@ if test "$cross_compiling" = yes; then
   ac_cv_func_mmap_file=no
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2938 "configure"
+#line 2937 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 /* Test by Zack Weinberg.  Modified from MMAP_ANYWHERE test by
@@ -2971,7 +2970,7 @@ int main()
   exit(0);
 }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:2975: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
+if { (eval echo configure:2974: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
 then
   ac_cv_func_mmap_file=yes
 else
@@ -2999,12 +2998,12 @@ for ac_func in bcopy bzero bcmp \
 	strsignal putc_unlocked fputs_unlocked strstr environ
 do
 echo $ac_n "checking whether $ac_func must be declared""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:3003: checking whether $ac_func must be declared" >&5
+echo "configure:3002: checking whether $ac_func must be declared" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gcc_cv_decl_needed_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 3008 "configure"
+#line 3007 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 #include <stdio.h>
@@ -3041,7 +3040,7 @@ int main() {
 char *(*pfn) = (char *(*)) $ac_func
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:3045: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:3044: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "gcc_cv_decl_needed_$ac_func=no"
 else
@@ -3070,12 +3069,12 @@ done
 for ac_func in malloc realloc calloc free
 do
 echo $ac_n "checking whether $ac_func must be declared""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:3074: checking whether $ac_func must be declared" >&5
+echo "configure:3073: checking whether $ac_func must be declared" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gcc_cv_decl_needed_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 3079 "configure"
+#line 3078 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 #include <stdio.h>
@@ -3115,7 +3114,7 @@ int main() {
 char *(*pfn) = (char *(*)) $ac_func
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:3119: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:3118: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "gcc_cv_decl_needed_$ac_func=no"
 else
@@ -3144,12 +3143,12 @@ done
 for ac_func in getrlimit setrlimit getrusage
 do
 echo $ac_n "checking whether $ac_func must be declared""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:3148: checking whether $ac_func must be declared" >&5
+echo "configure:3147: checking whether $ac_func must be declared" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gcc_cv_decl_needed_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 3153 "configure"
+#line 3152 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 #include <stdio.h>
@@ -3190,7 +3189,7 @@ int main() {
 char *(*pfn) = (char *(*)) $ac_func
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:3194: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:3193: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "gcc_cv_decl_needed_$ac_func=no"
 else
@@ -3218,12 +3217,12 @@ done
 
 # mkdir takes a single argument on some systems. 
 echo $ac_n "checking if mkdir takes one argument""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:3222: checking if mkdir takes one argument" >&5
+echo "configure:3221: checking if mkdir takes one argument" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gcc_cv_mkdir_takes_one_arg'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 3227 "configure"
+#line 3226 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 #include <sys/types.h>
@@ -3240,7 +3239,7 @@ int main() {
 mkdir ("foo", 0);
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:3244: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:3243: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   gcc_cv_mkdir_takes_one_arg=no
 else
@@ -6681,15 +6680,15 @@ fi
 
 
         echo $ac_n "checking for strerror in -lcposix""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6685: checking for strerror in -lcposix" >&5
+echo "configure:6684: checking for strerror in -lcposix" >&5
 ac_lib_var=`echo cposix'_'strerror | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   ac_save_LIBS="$LIBS"
 LIBS="-lcposix  $LIBS"
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6693 "configure"
+#line 6692 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* Override any gcc2 internal prototype to avoid an error.  */
 /* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
@@ -6700,7 +6699,7 @@ int main() {
 strerror()
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6704: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6703: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var=yes"
 else
@@ -6723,12 +6722,12 @@ fi
   
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for working const""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6727: checking for working const" >&5
+echo "configure:6726: checking for working const" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_c_const'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6732 "configure"
+#line 6731 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 int main() {
@@ -6777,7 +6776,7 @@ ccp = (char const *const *) p;
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6781: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6780: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_c_const=yes
 else
@@ -6798,21 +6797,21 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for inline""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6802: checking for inline" >&5
+echo "configure:6801: checking for inline" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_c_inline'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   ac_cv_c_inline=no
 for ac_kw in inline __inline__ __inline; do
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6809 "configure"
+#line 6808 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 int main() {
 } $ac_kw foo() {
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6816: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6815: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_c_inline=$ac_kw; break
 else
@@ -6838,12 +6837,12 @@ EOF
 esac
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for off_t""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6842: checking for off_t" >&5
+echo "configure:6841: checking for off_t" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_off_t'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6847 "configure"
+#line 6846 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #if STDC_HEADERS
@@ -6871,12 +6870,12 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for size_t""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6875: checking for size_t" >&5
+echo "configure:6874: checking for size_t" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_size_t'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6880 "configure"
+#line 6879 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #if STDC_HEADERS
@@ -6906,19 +6905,19 @@ fi
 # The Ultrix 4.2 mips builtin alloca declared by alloca.h only works
 # for constant arguments.  Useless!
 echo $ac_n "checking for working alloca.h""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6910: checking for working alloca.h" >&5
+echo "configure:6909: checking for working alloca.h" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_alloca_h'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6915 "configure"
+#line 6914 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <alloca.h>
 int main() {
 char *p = alloca(2 * sizeof(int));
 ; return 0; }
